RangeComparePoint.summary:
The Range.comparePoint() method returns -1,
0, or 1 depending on whether the referenceNode is
before, the same as, or after the .

remarks.para:
If the reference node is a of type ,
, or , then offset is the number of
characters from the start of reference node. For other
types, offset is the number of child nodes between the start of the reference
node.
